text.p: - Russia is dramatically losing its influence over members of the Commonwealth of Independent States, says Valery Serov, Russia's deputy prime minister in charge of CIS affairs.
- Russia's gold output may drop significantly if the practice of underpaying gold producers continues.
- The Russian gas giant Gazprom is to sign today a $2,5 billion agreement with a consortium of foreign banks to finance building a new transEuropean pipeline.
- According to the new Russian tax code control over individual tax payers will be tightened.
- Russian President Boris Yeltsin, recovering from illness, expressed his discontent not only with the government but with his imagemakers who have allowed an image of a disabled president to emerge.
- Despite negative public opinion, tough economic situation and common sense, Russia is to go ahead with a plan to build a new high speed rail road connecting Moscow and St Petersburg.

- Major personnel reshuffle in the government and close presidential surrounding, expected to take place soon, have one obvious aim -- to relieve President Yeltsin of personal responsibility for disintegration of the country and collapse of its economy and army.
- General Viktor Chechevatov who is tipped by many to become the new Russian defence minister, is known as a team member of Pavel Grachev, the former country's defence minister.
